trans-unit.source: Service Bus topics and subscriptions support a publish/subscribe messaging communication model.
trans-unit.target: Service Bus topics and subscriptions support a publish/subscribe messaging communication model.

trans-unit.source: When using topics and subscriptions, components of a distributed application do not communicate directly with each other; instead they exchange messages via a topic, which acts as an intermediary.
trans-unit.target: When using topics and subscriptions, components of a distributed application do not communicate directly with each other; instead they exchange messages via a topic, which acts as an intermediary.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>TopicConcepts</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>TopicConcepts</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In contrast with Service Bus queues, in which each message is processed by a single consumer, topics and subscriptions provide a "one-to-many" form of communication, using a publish/subscribe pattern.
trans-unit.target: In contrast with Service Bus queues, in which each message is processed by a single consumer, topics and subscriptions provide a "one-to-many" form of communication, using a publish/subscribe pattern.

trans-unit.source: It is possible to register multiple subscriptions to a topic.
trans-unit.target: It is possible to register multiple subscriptions to a topic.

trans-unit.source: When a message is sent to a topic, it is then made available to each subscription to handle/process independently.
trans-unit.target: When a message is sent to a topic, it is then made available to each subscription to handle/process independently.

trans-unit.source: A subscription to a topic resembles a virtual queue that receives copies of the messages that were sent to the topic.
trans-unit.target: A subscription to a topic resembles a virtual queue that receives copies of the messages that were sent to the topic.

trans-unit.source: You can optionally register filter rules for a topic on a per-subscription basis, which allows you to filter/restrict which messages to a topic are received by which topic subscriptions.
trans-unit.target: You can optionally register filter rules for a topic on a per-subscription basis, which allows you to filter/restrict which messages to a topic are received by which topic subscriptions.

trans-unit.source: Service Bus topics and subscriptions enable you to scale to process a very large number of messages across a very large number of users and applications.
trans-unit.target: Service Bus topics and subscriptions enable you to scale to process a very large number of messages across a very large number of users and applications.

trans-unit.source: To begin using Service Bus topics and subscriptions in Azure, you must first create a service namespace.
trans-unit.target: To begin using Service Bus topics and subscriptions in Azure, you must first create a service namespace.

trans-unit.source: A service namespace provides a scoping container for addressing Service Bus resources within your application.
trans-unit.target: A service namespace provides a scoping container for addressing Service Bus resources within your application.

trans-unit.source: To create a service namespace:
trans-unit.target: To create a service namespace:

trans-unit.source: Log on to the <linkText>Azure Management Portal</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: Log on to the <linkText>Azure Management Portal</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: In the left navigation pane of the Management Portal, click Service Bus.
trans-unit.target: In the left navigation pane of the Management Portal, click Service Bus.

trans-unit.source: In the lower pane of the Management Portal, click Create.
trans-unit.target: In the lower pane of the Management Portal, click Create.

trans-unit.source: In the Add a new namespace dialog, enter a namespace name.
trans-unit.target: In the Add a new namespace dialog, enter a namespace name.

trans-unit.source: The system immediately checks to see if the name is available.
trans-unit.target: The system immediately checks to see if the name is available.

trans-unit.source: After making sure the namespace name is available, choose the country or region in which your namespace should be hosted (make sure you use the same country/region in which you are deploying your compute resources).
trans-unit.target: After making sure the namespace name is available, choose the country or region in which your namespace should be hosted (make sure you use the same country/region in which you are deploying your compute resources).

trans-unit.source: IMPORTANT: Pick the same region that you intend to choose for deploying your application.
trans-unit.target: IMPORTANT: Pick the same region that you intend to choose for deploying your application.

trans-unit.source: This will give you the best performance.
trans-unit.target: This will give you the best performance.

trans-unit.source: Leave the other fields in the dialog with their default values (Messaging and Standard Tier), then click the check mark.
trans-unit.target: Leave the other fields in the dialog with their default values (Messaging and Standard Tier), then click the check mark.

trans-unit.source: The system now creates your service namespace and enables it.
trans-unit.target: The system now creates your service namespace and enables it.

trans-unit.source: You might have to wait several minutes as the system provisions resources for your account.
trans-unit.target: You might have to wait several minutes as the system provisions resources for your account.

trans-unit.source: In order to perform management operations, such as creating a topic or subscription on the new namespace, you must obtain the management credentials for the namespace.
trans-unit.target: In order to perform management operations, such as creating a topic or subscription on the new namespace, you must obtain the management credentials for the namespace.

trans-unit.source: You can obtain these credentials from the Azure management portal.
trans-unit.target: You can obtain these credentials from the Azure management portal.

trans-unit.source: In the left navigation pane, click the Service Bus node to display the list of available namespaces:
trans-unit.target: In the left navigation pane, click the Service Bus node to display the list of available namespaces:

trans-unit.source: Click on the namespace you just created from the list shown: <linkText></linkText>
trans-unit.target: Click on the namespace you just created from the list shown: <linkText></linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click Configure to view the shared access policies for your namespace.
trans-unit.target: Click Configure to view the shared access policies for your namespace.

trans-unit.source: Make a note of the primary key, or copy it to the clipboard.
trans-unit.target: Make a note of the primary key, or copy it to the clipboard.

trans-unit.source: http://manage.windowsazure.com
trans-unit.target: http://manage.windowsazure.com
